intro: Pterospermum menglunense, commonly known as the Menglun pterospermum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern China, particularly in the Yunnan province, where it grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
